Html: I am trying to find a way to use offline tiles. .meta files seem to be an efficient option, but I can't figure out if GMap.NET is capable of using them... or will I have to pre-render png files?

according https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/zbk7dbtb(v=vs.110).aspx

i didn't test it if it works today, but it's for sure possible to implement it in https://greatmaps.codeplex.com/SourceControl/latest#GMap.NET.WindowsForms/GMap.NET.WindowsForms/GMapImage.cs

Well, it has to be .EMF, EMF+, WMF extension-specific. I have files that have .meta extension per OSM stand I get them through render_list -a from the tile server I set up. Trying to figure out how I can run this thing off-line. If I can't figure out this .meta thing, I'll try to generate .png tiles, but linux installation of certain packages is giving me issues. For example, right now I'm stuck with problems in regards to the mod_tile package and it completely broken generated Makefile.
Nevermind. I just went ahead and figured out how to pre-render png files. Next step will be figuring out how to use those, but I'll do that once rendering finishes (lengthy process).
